title: Moderating abuse
body:
Periscope (NA) Moderator  - 8 minutes ago
Hey there!

We definitely want to discourage people from using "gay" especially in a negative aspect, mostly because of the implication that "gay" or being gay would be a negative or insulting thing in the first place.

Thus why it came with the comment: "We do not tolerate comments that serve to demean or diminish another group of individuals based on their personal beliefs, lifestyle, or background."

This is what you said as a moderator
"At about the same time, a new, pejorative use became prevalent in some parts of the world. Among younger speakers, the word has a meaning ranging from derision (e.g., equivalent to rubbish or stupid) to a light-hearted mockery or ridicule (e.g., equivalent to weak, unmanly, or lame). In this use, the word rarely means "homosexual", as it is often used, for example, to refer to an inanimate object or abstract concept of which one disapproves. The extent to which these usages still retain connotations of homosexuality has been debated and harshly criticized.[6][7]"
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gay
Its not meant to demean or diminish anyone, its a current use of the word in young culture, trying to forcefully remove it is not a solution and should never be one because people want to "force" take offense to it. And not allowing people to comment on the thread anymore when theres a useful discussion going on shows that we dont want to learn whats right but we just want to force those in power's beliefs on those who dont have control of the situation.
